title: ScrollViewer overpan API
body: Currently when you overpan a ScrollViewer, where's no way to tell how much negative offset it is unless you do hacks like calculating it every 50ms via a Timer.

comments.body: Please take a look at this proposal for the Windows UI library and give it feedback
For pulling to refresh, you can try https://www.nuget.org/packages/PullToRefresh.UWP

You can use the ViewChanging event to figure out whether an inertial change has started, its direction is upwards and the start VerticalOffset is 0 (i.e over-panned). This would happen only when the user lets go while the scrollviewer is over stretched downwards.
Solved it! Here's the code: http://imgur.com/CRNoX1w

The Refresh should happen ONLY when the Pointer is released while the VerticalOffset of the ScrollViewer is exactly 0. But when i get notified through DIrectManipulationCompleted that the user is no longer touching the screen it is too late since the VerticalOffset has already been changed
I need this also! I have no way of cancelling the refresh when the user overpans to the limit and then pans back up the opposite side without removing their fingers from the screen!
Totally agree zerowsl. The `DirectManipulationCompleted` event is called too late. Would be nice to have a pointer released event for it!
I think it will be better if there are some apis like ''DirectManipulationPointerReleased'' for scrollviewer
Brandon, I am actually walking about xaml ScrollViewer, not WinJS. :)

FYI, you can do pull-to-refresh using snap points (and two scrollers) as explained here:
http://dwcares.com/pull-to-refresh-2/
